title: Font choice for a book of poems
content:
I’m looking for some opinion on a choice of font for a book of poems. The mood of the book is somewhat despondent; poems of death, holocaust, graveyards, historical references to gruesome battles and struggles of faith. I’m thinking along the lines of Vendetta. Minion is too generic, Warnock is too happy. Fairfield is nice but it feels too much like old literature.

I guess I want something with a just bit of an edge to it, but not so much as to distract from the reading.

It’s a book of poems, not a novel, so pure function isn’t so important.

Tell me if you think Vendetta, or someting like it might work. Any other suggestions are welcome!

Thanks
author: Bouch

comments.content: I don’t think it matters if its all about the content, but I would look at Emigre’s Dalliance Script as long as the poems aren’t too long. Its elegant and might provide an edge to the presentation.
[Walbaum](http://web.archive.org/web/20051125105016/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.108142.0.0) may be appropriate as it’s very serious. But I think Vendetta is an excellent choice.

[Rodrigo Xavier Cavazos](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Rodrigo%20Xavier%20Cavazos)’ [Eidetic Neo](http://web.archive.org/web/20051125105016/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&font_categories_search=font_name_search&searchstr=eidetic&image.x=0&image.y=0) or [Peter Fraterdeus](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Peter%20Fraterdeus)’ [Prospera](http://web.archive.org/web/20051125105016/http:/www.philsfonts.com/showing.html?sku=AI000026X1P1&start=1)

A little leftfield, a tad dark, conspicuously contemporary, and perfect for poetry.

You could misuse Eldorado Micro.

What genre of poetry?

A couple of weeks aog I proposed a poetry book layout using triplex italic, it looks very sharp with enough line spacing, however it was a short book and the poetry was of a very contemporary style.

Maybe it Storm’s Serapion would do the job.

Héctor

It’s hard so say what genre not knowing a great deal about poetry. From what I’ve read so far, it’s not gothic, or dark really, yet the poems are about death and stuff. It’s more like he’s writing about these things from a distance, honestly, but with a certain degree of animosity.

Eldorado Micro is a bit too much, but the roman is quit fine. I love the hand-crafted feel of it. And Prospera is worth trying out for sure. Does the Prospera family contain more glyphs than the website shows?

Vendetta seems like quite a good choice. But I’m also getting this feeling that you need two distinct voices: something coarse but well-proportioned like Vendetta; but also something clinical and austere, like a Didone, an old-fashioned one, somewhat archaic, maybe turn-of-the-century French. As G W Ovink said\*, “Bodoni is an admirable letter for a death notice!” The trick though would be choose two fonts that both contrast and match.

\* Actually, that’s a collage of two of his phrases.

hhp
I like Prospera. What about Remontoire? Or Jannon from Storm?
Thanks for everyone’s input. It’s been helpful, and reassuring.

ack! i hope i’m not to late, but another Storm suggestion (or 2):  
what says “edge” better than [Pentagramme](http://web.archive.org/web/20051125105016/http:/www.stormtype.com/penta.html)  
or if that a bit _too_ edgy, try [Pentagraf](http://web.archive.org/web/20051125105016/http:/www.stormtype.com/pentagraf.html).
I second Walbaum. That would really fit the look, I think, it’s a fantastic typeface.
The typeface perfect for your book was just released last week: [Freight](http://web.archive.org/web/20051125105016/http:/www.garagefonts.com/typespecimens_2.html?sku=GF060017X1P2&start=1).
